channel.title: BigBrother and pistons
channel.description: So, there is absolutely no way for BigBrother to record what pistons do at the moment, which means that, once enabled, all sorts of greifing can happen with them that absolutely cannot be rolled back. What should we do about this?

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:

Remember, pistons can only move things that are 12 blocks long or less.

In which case, people can see who placed the piston still (right?), report them for griefing, then fix the 12 blocks with another piston?

If you can move it with a piston, you can move it back just as well

item.title: BigBrother and pistons
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:3, topic:403490”]Everyone can use doors/buttons/levers in a residence, I thought that would be fair since you can still bar access with iron doors and other things.

Also, residence won’t protect against this either, as I could create a piston right on the border of a residence, and have it push a line of blocks in to move walls in the protected residence, since bukkit has no way to do anything with pistons.

In other words, residence doesn’t protect against this either.[/quote]

Well damn, I say lets just go with it until we start hearing odd reports about moved blocks.

item.title: BigBrother and pistons
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Just enable them. They should have protected their areas with residence.

The residence plugin disables people not added into the residence from using doors, buttons, or levers (should the owner disable that flag, I have).

It also disables people from building so I’m sure that it shouldn’t harm much. How about you turn on the pistons and if we get a serious case of the problem disable them until we can find a fix.
